intro: Stillingia jacobinensis, commonly known as Jacobin's stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, alternate leaves, and striking blue to purple flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
